title: Deep divides exposed at ECB as rate-setters rail against stimulus
text:
Rebel rate-setters at the European Central Bank warned that its money-printing programme should only be used as a “last resort” as minutes from their September meeting revealed deep divides over its stimulus package.

Many of the ECB’s policymakers voiced their opposition to restarting quantitative easing and introducing a tiering system to mitigate damaging side effects on banks from negative interest rates.

The minutes said that several rate-setters believed that QE – where it injects money into the economy by buying state bonds – should only be used as a “last resort” and is less effective in the world of ultra-low interest rates.
